docs.snippet: The Cunard steamship Niagara, with London and Liverpool advices to the 31st of July, arrived at Boston yesterday morning, and her mails. dispatched south in the early train, reached this City in the afternoon. Some details of the news telegraphed...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Cunard steamship Niagara, with London and Liverpool advices to the 31st of July, arrived at Boston yesterday morning, and her mails. dispatched south in the early train, reached this City in the afternoon. Some details of the news telegraphed from Halifax, will be found elsewhere, but we find little additional intelligence in our foreign files.

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH,; FROM WASHINGTON. A Military Staff fer Wahsington and Orege--Force to be Kept in Upan, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: Preparations are being made tor the organization of an efficient military staff for Washington and Oregon Territories, preliminary to the contemplated operations against the hostile Indians, and to prevent a repetition of such defeats as were experienced by Colonel STEPTOE.

docs.snippet: From the Newark Advertiser. The semi-annual meeting of the Editorial Association of New-Jersey, was held yesterday at Paterson, and was largely attended, nearly every press in the State being represented, and a number of Editors from other States...

headline.main: EDITORIAL FESTIVAL.; Convention of New-Jersey Editers.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Newark Advertiser. The semi-annual meeting of the Editorial Association of New-Jersey, was held yesterday at Paterson, and was largely attended, nearly every press in the State being represented, and a number of Editors from other States being present, together with several non professional guests.

docs.snippet: The Board of Commissioners of Health met on Friday. It was reported to the Board that Miss Susan Cross, residing in a cottage near the beach below Townsend's Dock, on the east side of Staten Island, died of yellow fever on the 11th inst.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Commissioners of Health. POLICE INTELLIGENCE. Sea and Ship News.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Commissioners of Health met on Friday. It was reported to the Board that Miss Susan Cross, residing in a cottage near the beach below Townsend's Dock, on the east side of Staten Island, died of yellow fever on the 11th inst.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Health Commissioners. THE LATE FORGERY ON FREDRICKS, THE PHOTOGRAPHIST-Julius A. Gilligan, a young man,was STOLEN PROPERTY RECOVERED.- A PRIVATE WATCHMAN ROBBED BY HIGHWAYMEN.--On Wednesday night, as Washington Cooper. THREATENED VIOLENCE TO THE CREW OF THE STEAMER VANDERBILT.--Th dificulty connected with A DESPERATE CHARACTER AT JONES' WOOD FESTIVAL.-Pat McCarthy, alias "Sam Kirk," but COMMISSIONERS OF EMIGRATION.- Police Intelligence. FIRE IN GRAND-STREET. Mayor's Office-- VIOLATION OF ORDINANCES. SELLING OBSCENE PUBLICATIONS.-

docs.lead_paragraph: The Health Commissioner met ?? Thursday. Present--The Mayor, Drs. ROOKWELL, MELLIR and THOMPSON, together with Mr. MESTON. The bark Ocean House was allowed to proceed to the City on the 17th inst. The brig Faustina was allowed to proceed on the 18th inst. The brig John Stevens was allowed to proceed on the 26th inst. The bark Celia petitioned for permission to proceed to the ?? Laid on the table.

headline.main: New-Caledonia-Objections to the Name and Formation of the New Colony.

docs.snippet: General JERTZ, the special representative of Nicaragua, with his suite is expected in this city tomorrow morning from Bedford Springs, where he has been to have an Interview with the President in relation to the affairs of his country. The policy of...

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; Movements of General Jerez--The Administration and the Nicaragua Transit--The Route to be Opened--The Ten Million Loat--The Ocean Mails--Laol Grand Decision. FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.lead_paragraph: General JERTZ, the special representative of Nicaragua, with his suite is expected in this city tomorrow morning from Bedford Springs, where he has been to have an Interview with the President in relation to the affairs of his country. The policy of the Administration in reference to the Nicaragua Transit has been thoroughly and definitely settled.

docs.snippet: From the Cincinnati Enquirer. 10th. Major McCULLOUGH--one of the Commissioners upon the part of the United States Government to negotiate with the Mormons in Utah-passed through our city yesterday, on his way East, and honored us with a call at the...

headline.main: Major McCullongh on His Way Home.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the Cincinnati Enquirer. 10th. Major McCULLOUGH--one of the Commissioners upon the part of the United States Government to negotiate with the Mormons in Utah-passed through our city yesterday, on his way East, and honored us with a call at the office of the Enquirer. The Major was in the enjoyment of excellent health, and came through from halt Lake City to Leavenworth (Kansas) in thirty-three days, by an overland journey across the plains.

docs.snippet: From the Columbia (Penn) Spy. We have received a hasty message from York Penn, conveying the sad and alarming intelligence that the most mightful contagious disease, Psora, is raging in that borough, defying the skill of the most experienced...
docs.lead_paragraph: From the Columbia (Penn) Spy. We have received a hasty message from York Penn, conveying the sad and alarming intelligence that the most mightful contagious disease, Psora, is raging in that borough, defying the skill of the most experienced physicians and carrying off, in a very few-hours, all whom it attacks.
